title: Google\Cloud\Shell\V1\Environment
name: Environment
description:
A Cloud Shell environment, which is defined as the combination of a Docker image specifying what is installed on the environment and a home directory containing the user's data that will remain across sessions. Each user has at least an environment with the ID "default".

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.shell.v1.Environment

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Immutable. Full name of this resource, in the format users/{owner_email}/environments/{environment_id}. {owner_email} is the email address of the user to whom this environment belongs, and {environment_id} is the identifier of this environment. For example, users/someone@example.com/environments/default.

params.name: data.id
params.description: Output only. The environment's identifier, unique among the user's environments.

params.name: data.docker_image
params.description: Required. Immutable. Full path to the Docker image used to run this environment, e.g. "gcr.io/dev-con/cloud-devshell:latest".

params.name: data.state
params.description: Output only. Current execution state of this environment.

params.name: data.web_host
params.description: Output only. Host to which clients can connect to initiate HTTPS or WSS connections with the environment.

params.name: data.ssh_username
params.description: Output only. Username that clients should use when initiating SSH sessions with the environment.

params.name: data.ssh_host
params.description: Output only. Host to which clients can connect to initiate SSH sessions with the environment.

params.name: data.ssh_port
params.description: Output only. Port to which clients can connect to initiate SSH sessions with the environment.

params.name: data.public_keys
params.description: Output only. Public keys associated with the environment. Clients can connect to this environment via SSH only if they possess a private key corresponding to at least one of these public keys. Keys can be added to or removed from the environment using the AddPublicKey and RemovePublicKey methods.

methods.name: getPublicKeys
methods.description:
Output only. Public keys associated with the environment. Clients can connect to this environment via SSH only if they possess a private key corresponding to at least one of these public keys. Keys can be added to or removed from the environment using the AddPublicKey and RemovePublicKey methods.
